definition.para: Metadata values which contain harmful language and have been deprecated.

instructions.para: This field is not visible to users.
Use the deprecated_values field to record metadata values which have been removed or replaced, in whole or in part, because they contain harmful language.

The field should not be used when making minor corrections, eliminating typographical errors, or removing or replacing values for reasons other than to remediate harmful language in digital-collections metadata.

If a value is removed or replaced for a field which already has deprecated values recorded, add the new value to existing deprecated_values field contents (do not overwrite or delete existing contents).
Enter a value including three components:
1) The label of the field where a value was replaced or removed. Use the field label at the time of change, if field labels in the collection have changed over time.
2) The entire value which was replaced or removed. Even if a portion of the deprecated value remains in the new value, record the entire value here.
3) The date on which the change was made. Format dates using the <a href="https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/">Extended Date/Time Format (EDTF) Specification.<a/>
Separate each of these components with two pipe (‘|’) characters, so that values are structured as follows:
[1. FIELD NAME] || [2. DEPRECATED VALUE] || [3. DATE VALUE REPLACED OR REMOVED]
Separate multiple values with a double semicolon--;;.

example.para: Title || Eskimos in umiaks alongside the GEO. W. ELDER, Plover Bay, Siberia, July 1899. || 2023-10
